page.title: 13Leisure in Hazelbury Bryan
page.content: Most people watch television for pleasure. Gardening is very popular, particularly amongst the older people. The church is very old and services well attended. We have many clubs; the Mothers Union, Scouts, Brownies, School PTA, and The Sunshine Club for older people. Our small local public house, The Antelope, seems popular, and involves people in pub activities like skittles, darts, dominoes, and cards. Just outside our 'D' block, The Plumber Manor, where Cliff Richard has stayed, is well known for its fine foods. To dine out, a villager has to travel to a local inn or a nearby town. The Fox at Ansty and the Green Man at King's Stag have good reputations. A small minority of people are involved with horses. Few participate in active games.
